topic.title: SHI Block to Interlaken Subsystem Connectivity Rules

body.p: The following rules, in addition to the PAM4 and NRZ rules, define the Interlaken interface configurations that are supported when selecting SERDES for use as an Interlaken interface. Connections from the SERDES to the Interlaken combined OTN packet interface (COPI) subsystem are defined by the host_cfg structure passed to the g5_api_device_init() API and the connections are configured when the g5_api_device_init() API is called.

li.p: Rule: an Interlaken interface can connect to any SERDES bank.

Rule: the device supports 3 x 200G or 1 x 500G Interlaken interface configurations. When using 3 x 200G Interlaken interface mode, each Interlaken interface is up to 12 lanes connecting to 25.78125 Gbps NRZ SERDES. When using 1 x 500G Interlaken interface mode, one Interlaken interface of up to 24 lanes connects to 25.78125 Gbps or 28.125 Gbps NRZ SERDES, or one Interlaken interface of up to 12 lanes connects to 53.125 Gbps or 56.25 Gbps PAM4 SERDES.

body.p: Given the 3 x 200G or 1 x 500G modes, the supported number of Interlaken interfaces and maximum lane width per interface for SERDES banks A, B, and C (# of controllers x lane width per controller) are as follows.
The following rules apply to each Interlaken interface that is configured.

li.p: Rule: the lanes of an Interlaken interface must connect to the same SERDES bank. A corollary to this rule is the lanes of an Interlaken interface cannot be split across SERDES banks.

Rule: an even number of SERDES lanes must be used for an Interlaken interface that uses 56.25 Gbps or 53.125 Gbps SERDES rates. The Interlaken Alliance specified use of RS-FEC for SERDES rates between 36 and 58 Gbps. An Interlaken interface with RS-FEC requires an even number of Interlaken lanes since a RS-FEC instance is used for every two SERDES lanes.
Rule: each Interlaken SERDES lane FEC pair must connect to a SHI block subgroup. This is because FEC encode / decode is performed on a SERDES lane FEC pair that is connected to a SHI block subgroup.

Rule: each Interlaken SERDES lane FEC pair must connect to a SERDES lane FEC pair of the mate device. This is because of the previous SHI block subgrouping rule. The device cannot re-order the SERDES lanes between subgroups.
Rule: Interlaken SERDES lane FEC pairs can be connected between the DIGI-G5 and mate device in any order. This is because FEC decoder performs lane re-ordering.

Rule: lane re-mapping between FEC encode and after FEC decode supports an arbitrary lane ordering for connections to the Interlaken framing layer. The re-mapping can be independently configured in the receive and transmit direction.

body.p: Figure 1 illustrates the rules that apply to each Interlaken interface. The FEC restrictions are new with the addition of support for PAM4 SERDES to the Interlaken standard and require special consideration. Specifically, failure to connect FEC pairs between mate devices would require modification of the PCB to correct as the device DSIS does not support remapping of lanes between SHI block sub-groups.

fig.title: Interlaken SERDES Lane Mapping Options at the FEC and Framing Layers

body.p: The Interlaken Integrated Packet Test Set (IPTS) within the device generates and monitors IPTS packet traffic (ILKN_PKT (IPTS)) carried over up to 120 channels within the COPI. The IPTS supports generation of programmable sequences of packet lengths and partially programmable payload patterns. Device software uses Interlaken channels to identify both the source and sink of ILKN_PKT (IPTS) traffic as well as connect the ILKN_PKT (IPTS) traffic to other device subsystems as illustrated in Figure 2.

li.p: Rule: an Interlaken interface is required to source and sink ILKN_PKT (IPTS) traffic.

fig.title: Use of the Integrated Packet Test Set Requires an Interlaken Interface

body.p: A device application may not require an Interlaken interface for other purposes but may use the IPTS to source and sink ILKN_PKT(IPTS) traffic. In this case, ensure four spare SERDES are allocated to provision a 4-lane Interlaken interface for use with the IPTS.
Example SERDES selections for 3 x 200G Interlaken interfaces where each interface is composed of 10 x 25.78125 Gbps NRZ SERDES lanes is as follows.

li.p: ILKN I/F #1 connected to bank A using SHI[4:2] and device SERDES pins SA_RXI/TXO_P/N[19:10]
ILKN I/F #2 connected to bank B using SHI[5:3] and device SERDES pins SB_RXI/TXO_P/N[23:14]
ILKN I/F #3 connected to bank C using SHI[2:0] and device SERDES pins SC_RXI/TXO_P/N[9:0]

body.p: Example SERDES selection for a 1 x 500G Interlaken interface composed of 12 x 56.25 Gbps PAM4 SERDES is as follows.

li.p: Connect to bank B using SHI[5:0] and SHI lanes [1:0] of each SHI block, device SERDES pins SB_RXI/TXO_P/N[21, 20, 17, 16, 13, 12, 9, 8, 5, 4, 1, 0].
